parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Senseless, foolish, inconsiderate. Properly, mindless, i.e. Stupid, ignorant, egotistic, rash, or unbelieving.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To sow, spread, scatter. Probably strengthened from spao; to scatter, i.e. Sow.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make that which was dead to live, cause to live, quicken. From the same as zoon and poieo; tovitalize.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To be dying, be about to die, wither, decay. From apo and thnesko; to die off.
